wikipedia_page.main: Hannah Jones is a British female dance music vocalist, who scored Three Top 5 hits on the Hot Dance Music/Club Play chart in the late 1990s.  Her first two songs hit #1 on that chart: "No One Can Love You More Than Me" in 1997 and "You Only Have To Say You Love Me" in 1998.  The latter also climbed to No. 65 on the Billboard Hot 100.

response: In 1991, P.J.B. featuring Hannah and Her Sisters, a UK group assembled by British songwriter, record producer and author Pete Bellotte and fronted by British singer Hannah Jones, released a dance cover of "Bridge Over Troubled Water" which reached number 21 on the UK Singles Chart. The group appeared on Top of the Pops as the opening act on the 26 September 1991 episode.

link_mentions.page: I Was Born to Love You (song)
response: Cover versions were released by Hannah Jones, Worlds Apart and Andrew W.K. in February 2011.

I Am What I Am (Broadway musical song)
response: * In 1998, Respect recorded a cover of the song featuring British singer Hannah Jones which was used in the British television series Queer as Folk. In 2004, Jones released a solo version of the song.

As well as working with Donna Summer, Bellotte and Moroder wrote and produced Roberta Kelly's 1976 dance hit "Trouble-Maker", and Suzi Lane's 1979 hit "Harmony". He produced, and wrote several tracks on, Elton John's 1979 album Victim of Love.Review of Elton John, "Victim of Love", Allmusic.com. Retrieved 27 April 2020  He has also worked with Janet Jackson, Cliff Richard, Shalamar, Tina Turner, Mireille Mathieu, The Three Degrees and Melba Moore. Biography, PeteBellotte.com. Retrieved 27 April 2020  In 1991, Bellotte had a British Top 40 hit with a dance music version of Simon & Garfunkel's "Bridge over Troubled Water" as P.J.B. featuring Hannah and Her Sisters, the featured artists being a US group fronted by British singer Hannah Jones. The song would go on to reach number 21 on the UK Singles Chart, with the group appearing on Top of the Pops as the opening act on the 26 September 1991 episode.

In the summer of 2006, Natalie was asked to record for a new compilation album Forever Bond which consists of remixes of classic Bond themes. Natalie chose to record "For Your Eyes Only" from the film of the same name. The album which also includes the likes of Kelly Llorenna, Angie Brown and Hannah Jones was released in Europe and America in late 2006.
